so today I will share with you my recipe
adapted from death let's begin for the
dough you will need 120 gram of
all-purpose flour 20 gram of milk powder
60 gram of butter at room temperature 30
gram of sugar and 1 egg for us
measurement just checked in the info box
below
first of all beat up one egg in a bowl
and divide into two pots next combine
the butter and sugar in a bowl and beat
well for two minutes until fluffy then
add half of the egg and beat on low
speed until combined and mix the flour
with the milk powder then add the flour
mix it until the dough is forms
cover with plastic wrap and revista
rates for 25 minutes for the fillings
you will need 250 gram of shredded
coconut 70 grams sugar 25 gram each of
milk powder and constat 30 gram of
glutinous rice flour and 25 gram of
butter and some roasted sesame for the
filling you just combine the sugar and
the shredded coconut in a pan then stir
and cook over medium heat for about 4 to
5 minutes and then add the cornstarch
little dry flour milk powder the butter
and a mix well for another 2 minutes
then take off the heat and leave to cool
after chilling divide the dough into 8
to 9 persons and press to the base of
the taught modes then use the folk to
make some holes so the steam can escape
and we have a crispy base of the coconut
at then place the coconut feelings to
feel the mole and press gently to form
it nicely next you want to brush the top
with the remaining of the egg and also
sprinkle some toasted sesame seeds on
top
if there is some extra pastry left you
can cut into strips and then weave on
top of the tartlets you want to make the
top for about 20 to 25 minutes at 180
degrees Celsius until they are golden
brown halfway through you want to rotate
the pan so all the tops are evenly
golden brown that's it simple right I'm
